H2465.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6119.def: = the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle

H4899.def: = a (non-eschatological) ruler appointed by God and anointed with oil by a prophet or priest

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H543.def: = marker expressing a speaker's solemn confirmation of the truth of a statement
